exercises.title: Debate Opening Phrases
exercises.instructions: Choose the most appropriate phrase to open your position in each context.

questions.question: You're at a formal academic seminar. How should you introduce your position?

options.translation: As far as I'm concerned, this is a catastrophe

options.text: მგონია, რომ ეს არის სერიოზული პრობლემა
options.translation: I think this is a serious problem
Perhaps this might become a problem

questions.explanation: Academic contexts require moderate hedging. 'მგონია' shows considered opinion without being too strong or too weak.

questions.question: Which phrase is most appropriate for presenting statistical evidence?

options.translation: I think that...
Statistical data shows
This is probably true

questions.explanation: When citing statistics, use factual presentation language. 'სტატისტიკური მონაცემები აჩვენებენ' is the formal, evidence-based phrase.
questions.explanationGeorgian: სტატისტიკის ციტირებისას გამოიყენება ფაქტობრივი პრეზენტაციის ენა.

questions.question: What's the softest way to express disagreement with someone older than you?

options.translation: This is wrong!
I can't agree 100%
Logically, that doesn't follow

questions.explanation: With respect for hierarchy, use 'არ შემიძლია შევთანხმდე 100%' for the softest possible disagreement.
questions.explanationGeorgian: იერარქიის პატივისცემით, უფრო თბილია არც სრული უარყოფა.

questions.question: Choose the phrase that shows intellectual humility:

options.translation: This is absolutely true
However, we can also look at it from another angle
Everyone should believe this

questions.explanation: Intellectual humility in Georgian debate is shown by considering multiple perspectives. This phrase demonstrates nuanced thinking.
questions.explanationGeorgian: ინტელექტუალური ნაკლებობა ქართულ დებატში რწმენით მრავალპერსპექტივულ მისალმებაზეა დაფუძნებული.

exercises.title: Hedging Practice
exercises.instructions: Complete the sentences with appropriate hedging phrases.

questions.question: _____ რომ ეს ცვლილება დადებითად იმოქმედებს ეკონომიკაზე.
questions.english: (I think / Perhaps) that this change will positively affect the economy.
questions.explanation: Both 'მგონია' (I think) and 'შეიძლება' (perhaps) work for hedging. 'მგონია' shows more conviction.

questions.question: _____ ეს არის გამორიცხული.
questions.explanation: 'არ არის გამორიცხული' is a diplomatic way to say something is possible.

exercises.title: Disagreement Translations
exercises.instructions: Translate the English disagreement phrases into Georgian.

questions.question: I partly agree with you, but we should consider...
questions.explanation: This is the standard Georgian expression for partial agreement with qualification.

questions.question: That's an interesting perspective, however...
questions.explanation: Acknowledge validity before disagreeing - this is culturally appropriate.

questions.question: You're right, but we should also consider the economic factors.
questions.correctAnswer: გაქვთ მართალი, თუმცა ასევე გასათვალისწინებელია ეკონომიკური ფაქტორები.
questions.explanation: This construction validates the other person first, then adds additional perspective.

exercises.instructions: Match the Georgian political terms with their English translations.

exercises.title: Debate Scenarios
exercises.instructions: Choose the most appropriate response for each debate scenario.

questions.question: You're discussing tourism development with an older Georgian colleague. They suggest 'more hotels equals more money.' You disagree gently. Choose your response:

options.translation: That's stupid! Tourism will be destroyed!

options.text: თუმცა, სხვა კუთხითაც შეიძლება შევხედოთ - გარემოს დაცვაც მნიშვნელოვანია
options.translation: However, we can also look at it from another angle - environmental protection is also important
I can't agree

questions.explanation: With an older colleague, use respectful disagreement that acknowledges their point while adding another perspective. Direct contradiction (option a) is culturally inappropriate, and option c is too blunt.

questions.question: In an academic debate about economic policy, you want to present statistical evidence. Which opening is most appropriate?

options.text: მგონია, რომ ციფრები ვერ აჩვენებენ მართლს
options.translation: I think the numbers don't show the truth

options.text: სტატისტიკური მონაცემები აჩვენებს, რომ უმუშევრობის მაჩვენებელი 10%-მდე გაიზარდა
options.translation: Statistical data shows that the unemployment rate has grown to 10%
Everyone knows the economy is bad

questions.explanation: In academic contexts, present evidence objectively using formal phrases like 'სტატისტიკური მონაცემები აჩვენებს'. Avoid opinion-stating phrases for data presentation.

questions.question: You're at a family supra (feast). Someone mentions Soviet education was better. Cultural context: Your disagreement needs to be very soft. Choose:

options.text: ასე არ შეიძლება უბრალოდ შევაფასოთ - სხვადასხვა მხრები იყო
options.translation: We can't just evaluate it simply - there were different aspects
That's wrong! Modern education is better!
Logically, that doesn't follow

questions.explanation: At a supra with cultural historical topics, use the softest framing possible. Acknowledge complexity rather than directly contradicting. Family gatherings require maximum respect.
questions.explanationGeorgian: სუფრაზე, ისტორიულ თემებზე, გამოიყენეთ ყველაზე რბილი ფორმულირება.
